Female/immature.description: The tail on Allen's Hummingbirds extends past the wings when perched, but on Calliope Hummingbirds the wings and tail are about the same length. Female/immature Allen's tend to have brighter coppery sides than Calliope.

The tail on Rufous Hummingbirds extends past the wings when perched, but on Calliope Hummingbirds the tail and wings are about the same length. Female/immature Rufous tend to have brighter coppery sides than Calliope.

Female/immature male.description: Female and immature Broad-tailed Hummingbirds are larger than Calliopes and their tails extend beyond the wingtips. Broad-tailed Hummingbirds have a thicker, longer bill than Calliope.
